data.name: String: return formatted string
data.description:
Challenge:
Given a buffer string, the length of the buffer string, the format string and the variable number of arguments, return a fully formatted string. The format rules are the same as those for the "printf" family of functions:

http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/cstdio/printf/

However, for this kata, you surprisingly don't need any particular knowledge of these formatting rules. You are not required to reimplement the functionality, instead you should simply do some "re-routing".

Example:
```
char buffer[SCHAR_MAX];
size_t bufferLength = sizeof(buffer) / sizeof(buffer[0]);
char *message = formatString(buffer, bufferLength, "%d bottles of %s!", 99, "Ovaltine");
(void)puts(message); // outputs: 99 bottles of Ovaltine!
```

Addendum:
This kata is actually very simple. Hint: consult the C standard library documentation.

To successfully complete this challenge, you might want to be familiar with the *variable arguments* in C.

This kata does not require any memory allocation/de-allocation or error checking. You are guaranteed to receive valid parameters.
